benchmark_details.name: XRAG (eXamining the Core - Benchmarking Foundational Components in Advanced Retrieval-Augmented Generation)
benchmark_details.overview: XRAG is an open-source, modular codebase designed to evaluate foundational components of advanced Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems, providing a comprehensive benchmark for assessing their effectiveness across pre-retrieval, retrieval, post-retrieval, and generation phases.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a standardized framework for benchmarking advanced Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems and optimize their performance through comprehensive testing.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: While XRAG supports core RAG modules, its toolkit currently lacks comprehensive coverage of all RAG advancements and does not support RAG component training.

data.source: Three benchmark datasets: HotpotQA, DropQA, and NaturalQA, which are preprocessed into a unified format for RAG evaluations.
data.size: Total of 265,164 examples across all datasets
data.format: Unified dataset structured to facilitate performance testing for retrieval and generation modules.
data.annotation: Dataset sources include metadata from the original datasets, annotated for extracting relevant information.

methodology.calculation: Evaluation metrics are calculated based on the performance of RAG components across various configurations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better retrieval and generation performance.
methodology.baseline_results: Baseline performance metrics are provided for each dataset tested, with detailed comparisons between different approaches.
methodology.validation: The framework incorporates validation procedures to ensure reliability and accuracy of the evaluations.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The dataset is licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0.
